es.mityc.javasign.io

Class DecoderInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • java.io.FilterInputStream
        • es.mityc.javasign.io.DecoderInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class DecoderInputStream
extends java.io.FilterInputStream

    Implementación de FilterInputStream que permite filtrar los datos de entrada mediante un decodificador que implemente el interfaz IDecoder.

    Basado en el stream InflaterInputStream, adaptado para permitir una forma más general de decodificación.

      • read

        public int read()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a byte of uncompressed data. This method will block until enough input is available for decompression.
        Overrides:
        read in class java.io.FilterInputStream
        Returns:
        the byte read, or -1 if end of compressed input is reached
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred

      • read

        public int read(byte[] b,
                int off,
                int len)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads encoded data into an array of bytes. This method will block until some input can be decoded.
        Overrides:
        read in class java.io.FilterInputStream
        Parameters:
        b - the buffer into which the data is read
        off - the start offset of the data
        len - the maximum number of bytes read
        Returns:
        the actual number of bytes read, or -1 if the end of the encoded input is reached
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred
        • DecodingException if a encoding format error has occurred

      • available

        public int available()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Returns 0 after EOF has been reached, otherwise always return 1.

        Programs should not count on this method to return the actual number of bytes that could be read without blocking.

        Overrides:
        available in class java.io.FilterInputStream
        Returns:
        1 before EOF and 0 after EOF.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • skip

        public long skip(long n)
          throws java.io.IOException

        Skips specified number of bytes of decoded data.

        Could throw IllegalArgumentException if n < 0.

        Overrides:

        Returns:

        public boolean markSupported()
        Tests if this input stream supports the mark and reset methods. The markSupported method of DecoderInputStream returns false.
        Overrides:

      • mark

        public void mark(int readlimit)
        Marks the current position in this input stream.

        The mark method of DecoderInputStream does nothing.

        Overrides:
        mark in class java.io.FilterInputStream
        Parameters:
        readlimit - the maximum limit of bytes that can be read before the mark position becomes invalid.
        See Also:
        InputStream.reset()

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Repositions this stream to the position at the time the mark method was last called on this input stream.

        The method reset for class DecoderInputStream does nothing except throw an IOException.

        Overrides:
        reset in class java.io.FilterInputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if this method is invoked.
        See Also:
        InputStream.mark(int), IOException
